abstracts.cdata!:
The Public-Private Partnership and
            Information Management for Regional Development Project for
            Madagascar assists the Government of Madagascar and the
            country's economic regions in developing model
            methodologies and tools that will promote regional
            development and facilitate investment programming. The
            project has three components. The first builds the capacity
            of the regional development committees through seminars and
            thematic workshops; prepares and completes the regional
            development framework (RDF); prepares regional public
            investment programs (PIP); sets up regional data units,
            public information centers, and regional economic accounts.
            The second component funds regional information and
            knowledge management. Specific activities include designing
            methodologies to prepare RDFs and regional PIPs; designing a
            regional information system; establishing a regional
            economic accounting system; carrying out follow-ups and
            ex-post evaluations; and designing and producing information
            material. The third component disseminates the model to
            other regions.
